title: XSDMiscellaneousData Types

metadata.description: Learn about XSDMiscellaneousData Types with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Other miscellaneous data types are boolean, base64Binary, hexBinary, float, double, anyURI, QName, and NOTATION.
Boolean Data Type
The boolean data type is used to specify a true or false value.
The following is an example of a boolean declaration in a schema:
<xs:attribute name="disabled" type="xs:boolean"/>
An element in your document might look like this:
<price disabled="true">999</price>
Note:
Legal values for boolean are true, false, 1 (which indicates true), and 0 (which indicates false).
Binary Data Types
Binary data types are used to express binary-formatted data.
We have two binary data types:
base64Binary (Base64-encoded binary data)
hexBinary (hexadecimal-encoded binary data)
The following is an example of a hexBinary declaration in a schema:
<xs:element name="blobsrc" type="xs:hexBinary"/>
AnyURI Data Type
The anyURI data type is used to specify a URI.
The following is an example of an anyURI declaration in a schema:
<xs:attribute name="src" type="xs:anyURI"/>
An element in your document might look like this:
<pic src="https://www..com/images/smiley.gif" />
Note:
If a URI has spaces, replace them with %20.
Miscellaneous Data Types
Name
Description
anyURI
base64Binary
boolean
double
float
hexBinary
NOTATION
QName
Restrictions on Miscellaneous Data Types
Restrictions that can be used with the other data types:
enumeration (a Boolean data type cannot use this constraint)
length (a Boolean data type cannot use this constraint)
maxLength (a Boolean data type cannot use this constraint)
minLength (a Boolean data type cannot use this constraint)
pattern
whiteSpace

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers XSDMiscellaneousData Types concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use XSDMiscellaneousData Types effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of XSDMiscellaneousData Types and how to apply it in your projects.
